message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it focuses on text classification and the use of graph convolutional networks to represent text structure. Additionally, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it proposes a novel approach to learning discriminative features from text data. The use of attention mechanisms also suggests that the paper may belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as attention is a common technique used in neural networks. Finally, the paper may also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as text classification is a common task in information retrieval.
